author: Jason Zweig
title: Banks Won Big in Washington. What It Means for Investors
text: The financial-deregulation bill passed by the U.S. Congress this week is the latest phase in the eternal tug-of-war between regulators and banks. As fast as governments impose limits on the financial industry, banks, brokers and other firms fight back. Itâ€™s been happening for millennia, and it probably will keep happening until the end of time. WSJ City PM: Hedge Funds Raise Bets Against Italy, US Websites Go Dark in Europe as GDPR Kicks In
